topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Installing the Operating System on ESX

ol.li:
Setup your configuration files, as follows:
See the sample set of configuration files in the ~/helion/examples/entry-scale-with-vsa directory. The accompanying README.md file explains the contents of each of the configuration files.
Copy the example configuration files into the required setup directory and edit them to contain the details of your environment: cp -r ~/helion/examples/entry-scale-with-vsa/* ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/
Begin inputting your environment information into the baremetalConfig.yml and cloudConfig.yml files in the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition directory. Full details of how to do this can be found here: Helion OpenStack 2.0 Input Model. In addition, if you need any changes from the defaults in network_groups.yml make those changes now.

Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/logging/main.yml file and under the Elasticsearch defaults section, change the value of vars.elasticsearch_cluster_name to something other than elasticsearch (bolded below): elasticsearch_cluster_name: "{{ LOG_SVR | item('vars.elasticsearch_cluster_name', default='elasticsearch') }}"
For example, you could use: elasticsearch_cluster_name: "{{ LOG_SVR | item('vars.elasticsearch_cluster_name', default='helioncloud') }}"

Commit all of your configuration files to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add --a . git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
This step needs to be repeated any time you make changes to your configuration files before you move onto the following steps. See Using Git for Configuration Management for more information.
